lead_paragraph: Lindsey Vonn, the overall women’s World Cup champion, and Jimmy Cochran won slalom titles at the United States Alpine Championships at Sugarloaf in Carrabassett Valley, Me., in a competition delayed by rain, snow and wind.Vonn led both runs to win the event in a combined 1 minute 26.31 seconds. Hailey Duke was second in 1:28.21, and Jenny Lathrop finished third in 1:28.42.Cochran successfully defended his title with a combined time of 1:26.69, with Cody Marshall (1:27.90) second and Tim Jitloff (1:28.16) third.The day started with the announcement that Sasha Rearick would serve as the men’s Alpine coach, replacing Phil McNichol, who announced his retirement last week.
